intro: Qualea perrinii, commonly known as the pink river dolphin plant, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink and white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of rivers, adapting to the humid and often waterlogged conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are broad and oval-shaped, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Qualea perrinii plays a role in the ecological balance of its environment, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
